intro: Anthospermum palustre, commonly known as marsh anthospermum, is a flowering plant native to wetland habitats in tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species with showy flowers and medicinal properties. The plant typically grows in shallow water or moist soil, often in marshes and along stream banks. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, berry-like fruits. The botanical features of Anthospermum palustre make it an important component of aquatic and wetland ecosystems.
